doc.after: During the short reigns of the older two of his three elder brothers, Ãthelbald of Wessex and Ãthelberht of Wessex, Alfred is not mentioned. An army of Danes which the Anglo-Saxon Chronicle described as the Great Heathen Army had landed in East Anglia with the intent of conquering the four kingdoms that constituted Anglo-Saxon England in 865.[11] It was with the backdrop of a rampaging Viking army that Alfred's public life began, with the accession of his third brother, Ãthelred of Wessex, in 865.
